articles.description: Latest on Mohamed Salah's Liverpool future before the Saudi transfer window closes on Thursday, plus the Ballon d'Or nominations are released.

articles.description: On the eve of the tournament's start, a finely balanced set of favourites raise expectations of perhaps the best Rugby World Cup yet.

articles.description: Players in the top tier of women's football in Spain have decided to strike over pay and conditions.

articles.description: This is the best Scotland side ever. But a cruel draw means anything other than perfect won't be enough, says Johnnie Beattie.

articles.description: Daniil Medvedev says "one player is going to die" because of the hot conditions on court as he beats Andrey Rublev in the US Open quarter-finals.

articles.description: Mali's Momo Sissoko, the nephew of the late Salif Keita, pays tribute to the first African Footballer of the Year.
articles.title: How Mali's 'Black Panther' became a football icon

articles.description: England head coach Jon Lewis says his young side have learned "valuable lessons" from defeat against Sri Lanka.

articles.description: Northern Ireland manager Michael O'Neill is targeting a repeat of his side's 2016 triumph against Hungary.

articles.description: Coco Gauff plays Karolina Muchova in Thursday's US Open women's semi-finals, followed by Aryna Sabalenka against Madison Keys.
articles.title: Will Gauff and Sabalenka be stopped at US Open?
